explanation: MHD_is_feature_supported: show_help calls this function; to determine whether show_help (directly or indirectly) uses memcmp to compare null-terminated strings you must inspect the implementation of this callee. MHD_NO, MHD_FEATURE_EPOLL, MHD_FEATURE_POLL: these macros/constants are used in the conditional around calls to MHD_is_feature_supported — include their definitions to see if they expand to anything that could invoke string comparison or affect the control flow that leads to memcmp usage. memcmp: the MISRA rule targets uses of memcmp for null-terminated string comparison — include the memcmp symbol/implementation/uses so the analyzer can detect any direct calls or indirect calls to memcmp in the call chain. printf: show_help calls printf repeatedly; include its declaration/any local wrapper to confirm no project-specific wrapper calls memcmp for string comparisons. self_name and tool_copyright: these global identifiers are passed to printf and could be implemented or wrapped in project code (or macros) that perform string operations; include their definitions to rule out any hidden use of memcmp when constructing or validating those strings.
